required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacodynamics, Preliminary Pharmacokinetics and Tolerability of BIBB 515 BS or Pravastatin in Hyperlipemic Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacodynamics, Preliminary Pharmacokinetics and Tolerability After Multiple Oral Doses of 2.5 mg o.d. BIBB 515 BS (Capsule) or Pravastatin 20 mg Over 2 Weeks in Hyperlipemic Healthy Male Subjects (Parallel Group Comparison, Randomized, Placebo Controlled, Partly Double Blind [Pravastatin Open])

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of pharmacodynamics (inhibition of oxidosqualene cyclase, MES as marker), effect on routine lipid profile parameters, safety and preliminary pharmacokinetics

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in total-cholesterol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in low density lipoprotein (LDL) - cholesterol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in high density lipoprotein (HDL) - cholesterol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in apo-lipoprotein B
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in lipoprotein (a)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage changes in triglycerides
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma at different time points (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma at different time points (tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent terminal elimination half-life of the analyte in plasma (t1/2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma at different time points (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Total mean residence time of the analyte in the body (MRTtot)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent clearance of the analyte in plasma after extravascular multiple dose administration (CL/f)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution of the analyte during the terminal phase (Vz/f)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Terminal rate constant of the analyte in plasma (λz)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up 336 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically relevant changes from baseline in physical examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically relevant changes from baseline in 12-lead ECG
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically relevant changes from baseline in lens examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and day 15

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically relevant changes in vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate, body weight)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to 324 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically relevant changes in laboratory parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to 324 hours after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Global clinical assessment by the investigator
primary_outcome.time_frame: On day 15 after first drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Monoepoxy-squalene (MES) plasma concentration at different time points
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, up to day 15
primary_outcome.description: as surrogate marker for squalene inhibition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male caucasian subjects as determined by results of screening
- Written informed consent in accordance with good clinical practice (GCP) and local legislation given
- Age ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 years
- Broca ≥ - 20 % and ≤ + 30 %
- Cholesterol level ≥ 5.4 mmol/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Surgery of gastrointestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurologic disorders
- History of orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells or blackouts
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of allergy/hypersensitivity (including drug allergy) which was deemed relevant to the trial as judged by the investigator
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) (≤ 1 month prior to administration or during the trial)
- Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug (≤ 2 months prior to administration or during the trial)
- Smoker (> 10 cigarettes or 3 cigars or 3 pipes/day)
- Inability to refrain from smoking on study days
- Alcohol abuse (> 60 g/day)
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation > 100 ml (≤ 4 weeks prior to administration or during the trial)
- Excessive physical activities (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range of clinical relevance
- Abnormal findings at eye lens examination
